flawed_nl_solution:
On Monday, Mr Castiel ate 2/5*600 = <<2/5*600=3000/2>>3000/2 sausages.
The remaining number of sausages after he ate 3000/2 on Monday is 600-3000/2 = <<600-3000/2=-900>>-900
On Tuesday, he ate half of the remaining sausages, a total of -900/2 = <<-900/2=-450>>-450.
The remaining number of sausages that he saved for Friday after eating -450 on Tuesday is -900--450 = <<-900--450=-450>>-450.
On Friday, Mr Castiel ate 3/4*-450 = <<3/4*-450=-675/2>>-675/2 of the sausages he had kept.
The remaining number of sausages after he ate -675/2 on Friday is -450--675/2 = <<-450--675/2=-225/2>>-225/2
#### -225/2

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 240, not 3000/2. It appears the value was multiplied by the reciprocal of the intended fraction.
